definitions.title: adj.
definitions.body: right, veritable, honest (prop. firm, upright; Syr. ki0n recte PS:1662)—abs. [[כֵּן]] Ex 10:29 + (on poss. cstr. v.

right, usu. indecl., oft. as subst. a right thing, esp. c. vbb. dicendi Ex 10:29 (J) [[כֵּן דִּבַּרְתָּ]], Nu 27:7 [[כֵּן דּׂבְרׂת]], Nu 36:5 (both P); [[כֵּן יַאֲרִיךְ]] Pr 28:2 (the) right (i.e. order and justice) shall last long (v. De Now VB); = adv. aright, of pronunciation Ju Jdg 12:6; also c. vb. agendi Ec 8:10 (on Is 33:23 v. III. [[כֵּן]] sub [[כנן]]); right well Ps 65:10; (Che; al. = so); c. [[לאׁ]], as adj., not right [[דְּבָרִים]] [[אֲשֶׁר לאׁ־כֵן]] 2Ki 17:9 things which were not right (vb. agendi); of heart of a fool Pr 15:7; Je 23:10; as subst. = what is not right, upright Je 8:6; c. vb. agendi [[לאׁ־כֵן]] 2Ki 7:9 that which is not right we are doing, Je 48:30 b.

veritable, true, [[כֵּן־חְדָקָה]] Pr 11:19 the veritable of righteousness = true righteousness; Is 16:6 = Je 48:30 a may be either their boastings are not true or (Thes Che Di Du Gr Gie al.) the untruth of their boastings ([[לאׁ־כֵן]] as cpd. cstr.); abs., in assent to something already said, Right! Correct! True! Jos 2:4.

pl. concr. honest (men) Ge 42:11, Ge 42:19, Ge 42:31, Ge 42:33, Ge 42:34 (all E).—II. [[כֵּן]] thus, so, v. p. 485 infr.; III. [[כֵּן]] place, base, v. sub [[כנן]]; IV. [[[כֵּן]]], [[כִּנִּם]], [[כִּנׇּם]], v. sub [[כנן]]. p. 487
